pullrequest.title: Fixes Frustum falsly reporting it contains AABB in some cases

content.raw: Somewhat tangential to this PR, this feature kind of strikes me as an encroachment upon the role of collision detection. I suppose there may be special cases (like this one) which are very important to us and have fairly straightforward solutions, while not being well-covered by collision detectors. Perhaps the cost-benefit trade off is in our favor on this use case, but I wonder if we should think about strongly preferring that this kind of functionality be deferred to dedicated collision detection frameworks, specifically so that we don't need to worry (as much) about doing bug fixes like this one.
